title: Enchanted bolts

properties.name: description
properties.value: Enchanted bolts are gem-tipped crossbow bolts enchanted through the Enchant Crossbow Bolt spell to obtain a secondary effect. All enchanted bolts can be traded, with the exception of enchanted jade bolts.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Enchanted bolts

Enchanted bolts are gem-tipped crossbow bolts enchanted through the Enchant Crossbow Bolt spell to obtain a secondary effect. All enchanted bolts can be traded, with the exception of enchanted jade bolts.

While players can only add certain gem bolt tips to specific metal bolts, dragon bolts can have any type of gem bolt tips added to them.

The enchanted bolt's effects are randomly triggered, and offer a variety of effects depending upon the type of gem tipped onto the bolts. The chance of the special effect occurring is increased by 10% upon the completion of the Hard Kandarin Diary.

The Zaryte crossbow has a passive effect that will increase damage inflicted by bolt effects by 10% of damage inflicted. For example, with enchanted ruby bolts, the bolt's special effect, Blood Forfeit, would deal 22% of the opponent's current hitpoints with a cap of 110 damage, rather than the usual 20% damage and 100 hitpoint damage cap.

Contents

  • 1 Enchanted bolt effects
  • 2 Chances of special effects occurring
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 See also

Enchanted bolt effects[edit | edit source]

Bolt type Name Description Animation
Opal bolts (e) Lucky Lightning A lightning bolt strikes the opponent, dealing extra damage (Visible Ranged level * 10%, rounded down).
Lucky Lightning
Opal dragon bolts (e)
Jade bolts (e) Earth's Fury A rock slide tumbles down on the opponent, preventing them from moving for five seconds.

Opponents with higher Agility levels are less likely to be affected.

Earth's Fury
Jade dragon bolts (e)
Pearl bolts (e) Sea Curse A mighty bolt of water splashes onto the opponent, dealing extra damage.

This effect is negated by opponents wielding water staves, but increased by fiery monsters such as dragons or opponents wearing fire staves.

Sea Curse
Pearl dragon bolts (e)
Topaz bolts (e) Down to Earth A pair of arms claw the player from underground, draining their Magic level by 1.
Down to Earth
Topaz dragon bolts (e)
Sapphire bolts (e) Clear Mind The opponent's mind is struck, causing them to lose Prayer points equal to 1/20th the attacker's Ranged level, and the attacker gains about half of them.[1]
Clear Mind
Sapphire dragon bolts (e)
Emerald bolts (e) Magical Poison Poisonous gas is dispersed towards the opponent, poisoning them starting at 5 damage.
Magical Poison
Emerald dragon bolts (e)
Ruby bolts (e) Blood Forfeit The player sacrifices 10% of their current hitpoints to deal damage equal to 20% of the opponent's current hitpoints. This damage is capped at 100 hitpoints.
Blood Forfeit
Ruby dragon bolts (e)
Diamond bolts (e) Armour Piercing The player ignores the opponent's defence level and their own accuracy bonuses while increasing their max hit by 15%.
Armour Piercing
Diamond dragon bolts (e)
Dragonstone bolts (e) Dragon's Breath A breath of dragonfire strikes the opponent, dealing extra damage (Visible Ranged level * 20%, rounded down).

This effect is negated by fiery monsters such as dragons and opponents with dragonfire protection (e.g. Antifire potion or anti-dragon shield)

Dragon's Breath
Dragonstone dragon bolts (e)
Onyx bolts (e) Life Leech The player leeches the opponent's vitality, dealing 20% extra damage and healing the player by 25% of the damage dealt.

This effect is negated by the undead, as they have no "life" to leech.

Life Leech
Onyx dragon bolts (e)

Chances of special effects occurring[edit | edit source]

The special attack of the Armadyl crossbow doubles the base activation chance for one shot, while the Zaryte crossbow will guarantee activation for one shot provided it is a successful hit.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 April 2015
(update)

Players no longer need to wear the Kandarin headgear 3 to benefit from the increased special effect activation chance.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

The chance of enchanted bolt special effects activating is increased by 10% while wearing Kandarin headgear 3.
